ingredients: 4 slices crusty bread (rye, sourdough or whole grain)
Optional: garlic cloves for rubbing bread
instructions: Heat butter or oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat
Crack eggs into pan, being careful not to break yolks
Season with salt and pepper
Cook until whites are set but yolks are still runny, 3-4 minutes
For over-easy, carefully flip and cook 30 more seconds
Toast bread until golden and crispy
Optional: rub warm bread with cut garlic clove
Place eggs on toast, garnish with fresh herbs if desired
Serve immediately while eggs are hot

ingredients: 2 cups daikon radish, cut into matchsticks
1 cup fresh young ginger, peeled and sliced paper-thin
Optional: yuzu peel or lemon zest
instructions: Cut daikon into thin matchsticks, about 2 inches long
Peel ginger and slice as thinly as possible (use a mandoline if available)
Place daikon and ginger in a clean glass jar
In a saucepan, combine rice vinegar, water, sugar, and salt
Optional: add mirin for sweetness
Bring to a simmer, stirring until sugar and salt dissolve
Let the brine cool completely
Pour cooled brine over daikon and ginger
Optional: add dried chili and yuzu peel
Make sure vegetables are completely submerged
Seal jar and refrigerate
Ready to eat after 24 hours, best after 2-3 days
Will keep refrigerated for 2-3 weeks

ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Bring a pot of salted water to boil
Cut guanciale into small cubes or slices
Cook guanciale in a skillet over medium heat for 2-3 minutes until crispy, remove from heat and set aside
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated Pecorino Romano, and plenty of black pepper until creamy
Cook spaghetti al dente according to package instructions
Drain spaghetti, reserving some pasta water
Place spaghetti in the skillet with the guanciale over high heat to coat with rendered fat
TURN OFF THE HEAT completely
Pour egg and cheese mixture over hot pasta and stir quickly - the residual heat will create a creamy sauce
If too thick, add a splash of pasta water to loosen
Serve immediately, topped with extra guanciale, grated Pecorino Romano, and black pepper
recipe.source: Recipes from Italy - Authentic Roman Carbonara

breakfast.name: Buckwheat porridge with milk and berries

ingredients: 1 cup milk (dairy, almond, or oat milk)
1 cup fresh or frozen berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
Optional: nuts or seeds for topping
instructions: Rinse buckwheat groats thoroughly until water runs clear
In a medium pot, bring water and salt to a boil
Add buckwheat, reduce heat to low, cover
Simmer for 15-20 minutes until water is absorbed
Remove from heat, let stand covered for 5 minutes
Fluff with a fork
Stir in butter and milk until creamy
Add honey or maple syrup to taste
Optional: add cinnamon or vanilla
Top with fresh or frozen berries
Optional: add nuts or seeds
Serve warm

recipe.title: Ryebread with butter
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

recipe.title: Sichuan mapo tofu
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

recipe.title: Kasha with butter and milk
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

ingredients: 4 tbsp natural peanut butter (creamy or chunky)
Optional: chia seeds or granola for topping
instructions: Choose ripe but firm bananas (some brown spots are good)
Peel bananas and slice into rounds or leave whole for dipping
Place peanut butter in a small bowl for dipping or spread on banana slices
Optional: drizzle with honey for extra sweetness
Optional: sprinkle with cinnamon
Optional: top with chia seeds or granola for crunch
Serve immediately for best texture

ingredients: 1 lb (450g) chicken breast or thighs, sliced
1 cup Thai eggplant or regular eggplant, cubed
1 tbsp palm sugar or brown sugar
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat
Add green curry paste, stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant
Add chicken pieces, stir-fry until browned on outside
Pour in 1/2 can coconut milk, stir to combine
Add fish sauce and sugar, cook 3-4 minutes
Add remaining coconut milk and chicken broth, bring to simmer
Add eggplant and bamboo shoots, cook 5 minutes
Add bell pepper, cook 3-4 more minutes until vegetables are tender
Remove from heat, stir in Thai basil and lime juice
Adjust seasoning with fish sauce or lime juice as needed
Serve hot over jasmine rice

ingredients: 3 cups cooked rice, preferably day-old and cold
Optional: protein of choice (chicken, shrimp, tofu)
instructions: Heat wok or large pan over high heat with 1 tbsp oil
Add beaten eggs, scramble quickly until just set, remove from pan and set aside
Add remaining oil to pan over high heat
Add garlic, stir-fry for 15 seconds until fragrant
Add carrots, peas, and corn, stir-fry for 2-3 minutes
Add cold rice, breaking up any clumps with spatula
Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, pressing rice against pan to get crispy edges
Return eggs to pan, add soy sauce and oyster sauce
Toss everything together for 1-2 minutes until well combined
Remove from heat, add white pepper and sesame oil
Garnish with green onions and cilantro if desired
Serve hot

ingredients: 1 cup mixed nuts (almonds, walnuts, cashews, pecans)
1 cup mixed dried fruits (raisins, cranberries, apricots, dates)
Optional: dark chocolate chips or chunks
Optional: pumpkin seeds or sunflower seeds
Optional: cinnamon or cardamom for seasoning
instructions: Choose raw or roasted nuts according to preference
If nuts are raw, toast them in a dry pan for 3-5 minutes until fragrant
Let nuts cool completely
Chop large dried fruits (apricots, dates) into bite-sized pieces
Combine nuts and dried fruits in a bowl
Optional: add dark chocolate chips for extra indulgence
Optional: add pumpkin or sunflower seeds for variety
Optional: sprinkle with cinnamon or cardamom
Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks
Portion into snack-sized bags for easy grabbing
Mix beef mince with soy sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar and garlic. Marinate for 30 minutes
Mix all bibimbap sauce ingredients in a bowl, set aside
Cook spinach: blanch in boiling water for 30 seconds, drain, squeeze out excess water, season with a little sesame oil and salt
Cook bean sprouts: boil in water for 5 minutes, drain, season with sesame oil and salt
Julienne carrots, stir-fry with oil and 1/4 tsp salt for 2-3 minutes
Slice shiitake mushrooms, stir-fry with oil and 1/4 tsp salt for 2-3 minutes
Fry eggs sunny-side up or to your preference
Cook marinated beef in wok over medium-high heat for 3-5 minutes until browned
Place steamed rice in bowls, arrange beef, vegetables, and egg on top
Garnish with seasoned seaweed
Serve with bibimbap sauce on the side
Mix everything together before eating
recipe.source: My Korean Kitchen - Authentic Korean Recipe
